025package com.github.siroshun09.event4j.simple;
026
027import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.caller.AsyncEventCaller;
028import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.caller.EventCaller;
029import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.listener.ListenerExceptionHandler;
030import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.listener.ListenerBase;
031import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.listener.SubscribedListener;
032import com.github.siroshun09.event4j.subscriber.EventSubscriber;
033import org.jetbrains.annotations.Contract;
034import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
035import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
036import org.jetbrains.annotations.Unmodifiable;
037
038import java.util.Collection;
039import java.util.Comparator;
040import java.util.concurrent.Executor;
041
042/**
043 * An interface to provide simple implementations of interfaces such as {@link EventCaller} and {@link EventSubscriber}.
044 *
045 * @param <K> the key type
046 * @param <E> the event type
047 * @param <O> the order type
048 */
049public interface EventServiceProvider<K, E, O> {
050
051    /**
052     * Creates a new {@link Factory}.
053     *
054     * @param <K> the key type
055     * @param <E> the event type
056     * @param <O> the order type
057     * @return a new {@link Factory}
058     */
059    @Contract(" -> new")
060    static <K, E, O> EventServiceProvider.@NotNull Factory<K, E, O> factory() {
061        return new SimpleEventServiceProvider.FactoryImpl<>(null, null, null, null);
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Gets the root class of events.
066     *
067     * @return the root class of events
068     */
069    @NotNull Class<E> eventClass();
070
071    /**
072     * Gets the {@link EventCaller}.
073     * <p>
074     * This {@link EventCaller} also dispatches to listeners of the higher class of the given event.
075     *
076     * @return the {@link EventCaller} implementation
077     */
078    @NotNull EventCaller<E> caller();
079
080    /**
081     * Checks if this provider supports getting {@link AsyncEventCaller} by calling {@link #asyncCaller()}.
082     * <p>
083     * If the {@link Executor} is set through {@link Factory#executor(Executor)}, this method returns {@code true}; otherwise {@code false}.
084     *
085     * @return {@code true} if {@link #asyncCaller()} can be used in this provider, otherwise {@code false}
086     */
087    boolean isAsyncCallerAvailable();
088
089    /**
090     * Gets the {@link AsyncEventCaller} that created with {@link #caller()} and the {@link Executor} which is set through {@link Factory#executor(Executor)}.
091     * <p>
092     * If the {@link Executor} is not set, this method throws {@link IllegalStateException}.
093     *
094     * @return the {@link AsyncEventCaller}
095     * @throws IllegalStateException if the {@link Executor} is not set ({@link #isAsyncCallerAvailable()} returns {@code false})
096     */
097    @NotNull AsyncEventCaller<E> asyncCaller();
098
099    /**
100     * Gets the {@link EventSubscriber} of the given event class.
101     *
102     * @param eventClass the event class to get {@link EventSubscriber}
103     * @param <T>        the event type
104     * @return the {@link EventSubscriber} of the given event class
105     */
106    <T extends E> @NotNull EventSubscriber<K, T, O> subscriber(@NotNull Class<T> eventClass);
107
108    /**
109     * Gets all currently available {@link EventSubscriber}s.
110     *
111     * @return all currently available {@link EventSubscriber}s in this provider.
112     */
113    @NotNull @Unmodifiable Collection<EventSubscriber<K, ? extends E, O>> subscribers();
114
115    /**
116     * Subscribes the given {@link ListenerBase}.
117     *
118     * @param listeners the {@link ListenerBase} to subscribe
119     * @return the {@link SubscribedListener}s
120     */
121    @NotNull Collection<SubscribedListener<K, ? extends E, O>> subscribeAll(@NotNull Iterable<ListenerBase<K, ? extends E, O>> listeners);
122
123    /**
124     * Unsubscribes the given {@link SubscribedListener}s.
125     *
126     * @param listeners the {@link SubscribedListener}s to unsubscribe
127     */
128    void unsubscribeAll(@NotNull Collection<? extends SubscribedListener<K, ? extends E, O>> listeners);
129
130    /**
131     * Unsubscribes listeners by the given key.
132     *
133     * @param key the key to unsubscribe listeners
134     * @see EventSubscriber#unsubscribeByKey(Object)
135     */
136    void unsubscribeByKey(@NotNull K key);
137
138    /**
139     * A factory interface to create {@link EventServiceProvider}.
140     * <p>
141     * The implementation of this interface is immutable, so all factory methods creates a new instance of {@link Factory}.
142     *
143     * @param <K> the key type
144     * @param <E> the event type
145     * @param <O> the order type
146     */
147    interface Factory<K, E, O> {
148
149        /**
150         * Sets the key class.
151         *
152         * @param keyClass the key class
153         * @param <K1>     the new key type
154         * @return the new {@link Factory}
155         */
156        @Contract("_ -> new")
157        <K1> @NotNull Factory<K1, E, O> keyClass(Class<? extends K1> keyClass);
158
159        /**
160         * Sets the root event class.
161         *
162         * @param eventClass the root event class
163         * @param <E1>       the new event type
164         * @return the new {@link Factory}
165         */
166        @Contract("_ -> new")
167        <E1> @NotNull Factory<K, E1, O> eventClass(Class<? extends E1> eventClass);
168
169        /**
170         * Sets the {@link Comparator} to sort listeners by the specified orders.
171         *
172         * @param orderComparator the {@link Comparator} to sort listeners by the specified orders
173         * @param <O1>            the new order type
174         * @return the new {@link Factory}
175         */
176        @Contract("_ -> new")
177        <O1> @NotNull Factory<K, E, O1> orderComparator(Comparator<? extends O1> orderComparator);
178
179        /**
180         * Sets the {@link Comparator} and the default order.
181         * <p>
182         * The default order is used when the order is not specified.
183         * If the default value is not null, no nulls passed to {@link Comparator}; Otherwise, it is possible to pass nulls to {@link Comparator}.
184         *
185         * @param orderComparator the {@link Comparator} to sort listeners by the specified orders
186         * @param defaultOrder    the default order that is used when the order is not specified
187         * @param <O1>            the new order type
188         * @return the new {@link Factory}
189         */
190        @Contract("_, _ -> new")
191        <O1> @NotNull Factory<K, E, O1> orderComparator(Comparator<? extends O1> orderComparator, O1 defaultOrder);
192
193        /**
194         * Sets the {@link Executor}.
195         *
196         * @param executor the {@link Executor} to create {@link AsyncEventCaller}
197         * @return the new {@link Factory}
198         */
199        @Contract("_ -> new")
200        @NotNull Factory<K, E, O> executor(Executor executor);
201
202        /**
203         * Creates a new {@link EventServiceProvider} without the custom {@link ListenerExceptionHandler}.
204         *
205         * @return a new {@link EventServiceProvider}
206         */
207        @NotNull EventServiceProvider<K, E, O> create();
208
209        /**
210         * Creates a new {@link EventServiceProvider} with the custom {@link ListenerExceptionHandler}.
211         *
212         * @param exceptionHandler the {@link ListenerExceptionHandler}
213         * @return a new {@link EventServiceProvider}
214         */
215        @NotNull EventServiceProvider<K, E, O> create(@Nullable ListenerExceptionHandler<K, E, O> exceptionHandler);
216
217    }
218}
